feed.title: Google Cloud: Gemini
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Gemini

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-12-16:vs code model selection issue fixed as of version 2.63.1:0
entry.content: The model selection issue affecting free tier customers using Gemini Code Assist releases 2.56 and later is fixed as of version 2.63.1.
entry.summary: The model selection issue impacting free tier customers with Gemini Code Assist versions 2.56 and later has been resolved. This fix is included in version 2.63.1.
entry.title: VS Code model selection issue fixed as of version 2.63.1: VS Code Gemini Code Assist: Model Selection Issue Resolved

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-12-12:known issue for the model selection feature in vs code gemini code assist:0
entry.content:
The VS Code Gemini Code Assist model selection feature incorrectly appears for users of the free tier of Gemini Code Assist for individuals.

  • The feature shouldn't appear for such users and does not function for them.
entry.summary: A known issue exists in the VS Code Gemini Code Assist where the model selection feature incorrectly appears for users on the free tier. This feature is not intended for free tier users and will not function if accessed.
entry.title: Known issue for the model selection feature in VS Code Gemini Code Assist: Gemini Code Assist: Model Selection Issue

entry.title: Known issue for the model selection feature in VS Code Gemini Code Assist: Gemini Code Assist: Model Selection Issue

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-12-05:outline in intellij (preview):0
entry.content:
The outline feature automatically creates AI-assisted documentation by generating short, English summaries of code blocks within the Outline tab of the Gemini Code Assist plugin. Outlines help developers to achieve rapid understanding and to focus on abstraction, without getting bogged down by syntactical details.

You can change the settings to disable automatic outline generation, which instead lets you generate outlines of files manually.
entry.summary: The Gemini Code Assist plugin in IntelliJ now automatically generates summaries of code blocks in the Outline tab. This feature helps developers quickly understand code by focusing on abstraction rather than syntax. You can also manually generate these outlines by adjusting the plugin's settings.
entry.title: Outline in IntelliJ (Preview): AI-generated code summaries in IntelliJ

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-12-05:finish changes in intellij (preview):1
entry.content: The finish changes feature acts as an AI pair programmer that observes your in-progress work and completes the job, eliminating the need to write complex prompts. The core strength of the finish changes feature lies in its flexibility, allowing you to use a mix of input styles, such as pseudocode, #TODOs, or half-written code. This combination minimizes distraction and ensures you remain in control of the high-level design.
entry.summary: The Finish Changes feature in IntelliJ acts as an AI pair programmer to complete your work, offering flexibility with various input styles like pseudocode, #TODOs, or half-written code while keeping you in control.
entry.title: Finish Changes in IntelliJ (Preview): Finish Changes in IntelliJ (Preview)

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-12-04:model selection for vs code gemini code assist:0
entry.content:
The following VS Code Gemini Code Assist users can now manually select the model used by Gemini Code Assist:

  • Gemini Code Assist Enterprise users
  • Gemini Code Assist Standard users
  • Gemini Code Assist for individuals, if you have a Google AI Pro or Ultra subscription
entry.summary: Users can now manually select the model used by Gemini Code Assist in VS Code.
entry.title: Model selection for VS Code Gemini Code Assist: Model Selection for VS Code Gemini Code Assist

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-12-04:model selection for vs code gemini code assist:1

entry.summary: Users can now manually select the model used by Gemini Code Assist in VS Code.
entry.title: Model selection for VS Code Gemini Code Assist: Model Selection for VS Code Gemini Code Assist

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-11-13:known issue in vs code 2.57 and later:0
entry.content:
The Gemini Code Assist 2.57 and later releases for VS Code have a known issue that prevents the extension from connecting to the server if you are using a gnc c runtime version that's earlier than 2.36.

  • You can permanently fix this issue by upgrading your gnu c runtime version to 2.36 or higher.
  • Alternatively, you can downgrade the Gemini Code Assist VS Code extension to version 2.56 until a fix is released.
entry.summary: A known issue in Gemini Code Assist VS Code extension versions 2.57 and later prevents connections if the gnu c runtime is earlier than 2.36. Users can either upgrade their gnu c runtime to 2.36+ or downgrade the extension to 2.56.
entry.title: Known issue in VS Code 2.57 and later: Gemini Code Assist: Connection Issue in VS Code

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-11-13:vs code server connection issue fixed as of version 2.58.1:1
entry.content: The server connection issue affecting Gemini Code Assist 2.57 and 2.58 releases is fixed as of version 2.58.1
entry.summary: The connection issue affecting Gemini Code Assist in recent versions has been resolved with the release of version 2.58.1.
entry.title: VS Code server connection issue fixed as of version 2.58.1: VS Code Connection Issue Fixed

The Gemini Code Assist 2.57 and later releases for VS Code have a known issue that prevents the extension from connecting to the server if you are using a gnc c runtime version that's earlier than 2.36.

  • You can permanently fix this issue by upgrading your gnu c runtime version to 2.36 or higher.
  • Alternatively, you can downgrade the Gemini Code Assist VS Code extension to version 2.56 until a fix is released.
entry.summary: A known issue in Gemini Code Assist VS Code extension versions 2.57 and later prevents connections if the gnu c runtime is earlier than 2.36. Users can either upgrade their gnu c runtime to 2.36+ or downgrade the extension to 2.56.
entry.title: Known issue in VS Code 2.57 and later: Gemini Code Assist: Connection Issue in VS Code

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-11-12:chat performance metrics:0
entry.content: Gain deeper insights into Gemini for Google Cloud's chat performance with metrics for chat acceptance rate and lines of chat accepted, including interactions in Agent mode and non-agentic chat. Combine these metrics with existing code metrics to calculate total acceptance and total lines of code accepted, providing a complete picture of Gemini's performance. For more information, see View Gemini for Google Cloud logs.
entry.summary: Get detailed chat performance metrics for Gemini for Google Cloud, including acceptance rates and lines accepted for both agent and non-agentic modes. Combine with code metrics for a full performance overview.
entry.title: Chat performance metrics: Chat Performance Metrics

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-11-12:code customization available in agent mode and gemini cli (preview):1
entry.content: Code customization is now supported when using Gemini CLI and agent mode in Gemini Code Assist.
entry.summary: Code customization is now supported when using Gemini CLI and agent mode in Gemini Code Assist.
entry.title: Code customization available in agent mode and Gemini CLI (Preview): Code customization in agent mode and Gemini CLI

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-11-12:inline diff is generally available (ga) for intellij:4
entry.content:
Inline diff is generally available for IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist. With the inline diff view, chat generated code suggestions are visually highlighted directly in your editor. This feature can boost productivity by offering immediate visibility on modifications, streamlining reviews and enabling precise control over integrating new code, all without leaving your current view.

If preferred, you can also change the diff view settings to have a side-by-side diff window instead of the inline diff.
entry.summary: Inline diff for Gemini Code Assist in IntelliJ is now generally available. This feature highlights code suggestions directly in your editor, improving productivity and code integration.
entry.title: Inline diff is generally available (GA) for IntelliJ: Inline diff now available for IntelliJ

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-11-12:inline diff is generally available (ga) for intellij:5

If preferred, you can also change the diff view settings to have a side-by-side diff window instead of the inline diff.
entry.summary: Inline diff for Gemini Code Assist in IntelliJ is now generally available. This feature highlights code suggestions directly in your editor, improving productivity and code integration.
entry.title: Inline diff is generally available (GA) for IntelliJ: Inline diff now available for IntelliJ

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini:2025-11-10:persistent memory for gemini code assist on github (preview):0
entry.content:
• Gemini Code Assist on GitHub now supports persistent memory, which stores your previous interactions with Gemini Code Assist on GitHub so that it has context during your future interactions.
  • For users of the enterprise version, persistent memory is enabled from the connection settings within the Google Cloud console. For users of the consumer version, persistent memory is enabled from the Gemini Code Assist site. For more information, see manage configuration files across multiple repositories.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist on GitHub has introduced persistent memory, which saves your past conversations to provide context for future interactions. This feature is available in both enterprise and consumer versions, with configuration options in the Google Cloud console or the Gemini Code Assist site, respectively.
entry.title: Persistent memory for Gemini Code Assist on GitHub (Preview): Gemini Code Assist on GitHub Now Features Persistent Memory

For users of the consumer version, persistent memory is enabled from the Gemini Code Assist site. For more information, see manage configuration files across multiple repositories.

entry.title: Persistent memory for Gemini Code Assist on GitHub (Preview): Gemini Code Assist on GitHub Now Features Persistent Memory
